Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.1a YP report they enjoy taking part in physical activities/sport
Example Questions: How much do you enjoy physical activities/sport? What is your favourite physical or sport activity?
Examples of Indicative Answers: (Very) enjoyable; able to name favourite activity(-ies); shares examples of engaging with sport
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Why do you say that? - Do you play the sport here or somewhere else? - Why do you enjoy it/not enjoy it do you think?
Comments: Only applicable to YOs that have physical activities and/or sport within their programme

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Example Questions: How much do you enjoy physical activities/sport? Rate from 1 to 10.
Examples of Indicative Answers: 7 or above
Comments: As above

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.1b YP report an increase in physical activity
Example Questions: Do you feel you are more physically active than you were 6 months ago?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Why do you think that is?
Comments: As above

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Example Questions: Have you started any new physical activities/sport since you joined the youth club? What have you started doing and why?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; able to name activities and explain why it attracted them
Comments: As above

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.1c Number of YP taking part in sport activities in YO in the last 6/9/12 months
Examples of Indicative Answers: Stable or increasing numbers over time
Comments: As above YOs are free to choose the time period they are reporting

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.1d YP report an increase in healthy eating habits
Example Questions: Do you feel you are now eating more healthily than you were 6 months ago?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes
Comments: Only applicable if the YO is intentionally working with encouraging healthy eating habits.  Requires a definition of healthy eating

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.1e YP are able to name healthy eating habits that they have taken up
Example Questions: Have you taken up any new healthy eating habits since you joined the youth club? What have you started doing and why?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes, able to name specific habits
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Why do you think that is?
Comments: As above

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Outcome: 1.2 Improved emotional well-being  Note: These questions and conversations should be followed up by YW presenting options of where YP can find support for their wellbeing, mental and emotional health (in or beyond YO)
Indicator: 1.2a Number of 1:1 conversations with YP around their well-being in the last 6/9/12 months
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - How many times have YP asked for help when they needed it? - How many referrals have been made to other more focused organisations?
Comments: These conversations can be initiated by both YP and YW

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.2b YP have access tools and resources to manage their mental health
Example Questions: Do you know where to go if you need help with your mental health/wellbeing? How did you learn about it?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; attributes learning about support to YO; able to name specific resources or support
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - How would you say your sleep/other related concepts are?

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.2c YP report feeling satisfied with their life
Example Questions: How happy are you with your life at this current moment? How happy are you in comparison to 6/9/12 months ago?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Happy or happier; content; satisfied; shares examples of positive things that have happened
Comments: To present this question in group settings, YP should have the choice to share their answers anonymously (e.g. through post-it notes, drawings, photographs)

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.3a YP feel that YO is a safe space to talk about their well-being
Example Questions: Would you talk about your mental health/wellbeing at your youth club (e.g. with youth workers)? Why/why not?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; able to name reasons or examples
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Why do you think that is?
Comments: Note: if the YP does not feel like they can talk about their wellbeing BUT is able to explain why or give examples, it can show their higher self-awareness (Outcome 2.2)

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Example Questions: Would you talk about your mental health/wellbeing at your youth club (e.g. with youth workers)? Why/why not?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; able to name reasons of examples
Comments: As above

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.3b YP feel that YO is a physically safe space to spend time at
Example Questions: Do you feel physically safe when spending time at your youth club? Why/why not?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes
Comments: The YO should be prepared to address concerns if YP say that they do not feel physically safe (e.g., an anonymous survey might not be a good tool to ask this question)

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.3c YP are able to reflect on what helps them to feel physically and emotionally safe at the YO
Example Questions: When do you feel safe at your youth club? What helps you feel safe at your youth club?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Able to name reasons and examples
Comments: As above (both related to emotional and physical safety)

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.4a YP report being able to solve problems
Example Questions: How do you feel when you encounter a new problem? How do you approach it?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Taking action/initiative to tackle the problem, finding support from others; asking for help

Outcome Area: 1 YP have better physical and emotional well-being
Indicator: 1.4b YP report developing healthy coping strategies
Example Questions: How do you feel when something goes wrong, or you make a mistake? What helps you feel better?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Learning from mistakes; Optimistic; Trying again; identifies specific things that help them feel better

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Outcome: 2.1 YP gain practical and life skills
Indicator: 2.1a YP are able to name skills they have learned
Example Questions: Have you learned any of the following skills at your youth club?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; tick off those from list of tangible and intangible skills
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Have you learnt anything else through attending youth club? - How have you used these skills elsewhere?

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.1b Number of YP attending skill-based workshops or activities within YO in the last 6/9/12 months

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.2a YP report understanding their emotions and feelings well
Example Questions: How well do you understand your own emotions and feelings? What has helped you to learn about yourself?
Examples of Indicative Answers: (Very) well; able to share examples of what helped to learn about themselves (e.g. YO activities, YWs, new people)
Comments: This may only be suitable for older YP who are able to reflect on their emotions.

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Example Questions: How well do you understand your own emotions and feelings? Rate from 1 to 10.
Examples of Indicative Answers: 7 or above

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.2b YP are able to name their personal strengths
Example Questions: What are your three personal strengths? Tell me how you apply them day-to-day.
Examples of Indicative Answers: Able to name three strengths and explain how they are able to use them in daily situations

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.3a YP report improved communication skills
Example Questions: Do you feel your communication skills have improved as a result of attending your youth club? If yes, can you share an example?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; able to talk about specific skills and/or scenarios where they were better at communication
Comments: Communication skills can include listening, empathy, sharing your opinion, teamwork, conflict resolution, respect, friendliness, tolerance

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Example Questions: Do you feel your communication skills have improved as a result of attending your youth club?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.3b YP report feeling comfortable working in a group
Example Questions: How did you feel during this group exercise?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Well; comfortable; myself; confident; happy
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Why do you think that was?

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.3c YP work well in a group
Example Questions: How did young people work in a group during this exercise? Have you seen any improvements over time in this group?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Collaboration; resolving conflicts efficiently; distributing work; listening; respectfully
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Have the YP put themselves forward for other group activities?
Comments: For an alternative way of measuring teamwork skills, see CFYI questionnaires (Adult and YP version, questions/statements under Teamwork section):  https://www.youthimpact.uk/key-resources/measurement-hub/adult-rating-youth-behaviour-aryb https://www.youthimpact.uk/key-resources/measurement-hub/youth-rating-socio-emotional-skills-yrss

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.4a YP gain accreditation or recognition of their achievements
Example Questions: What have been some of your achievements since you joined the youth club?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Shares examples of recognition
Comments: In and beyond YO YP might share this informally

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Indicator: 2.4b YP demonstrate interest in improving current and/or learning new skills
Example Questions: Is there anything at the moment that you would like to learn more about? What is it?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Shares specific interests/areas of interest

Outcome Area: 2  YP have increased social, emotional and life skills and knowledge
Example Questions: Have you observed young people taking interest in improving their current or learning new skills? If yes, please share some examples.
Examples of Indicative Answers: YWs are able to name examples of YP taking up learning opportunities

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Outcome: 3.1 Sense of ownership within youth work
Indicator: 3.1a YP report they feel involved in shaping youth work
Example Questions: How involved do you feel in shaping the activities at your youth club? If yes, please share some examples.
Examples of Indicative Answers: Feel involved; feel listened to; YWs understand what we want or need; able to share specific examples
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Is there anything else you would like to get involved in?
Comments: It can also include resources that the YO has

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.1b Number of YP who take responsibilities within the youth club over the last 6/9/12 months
Comments: Responsibilities can be defined by the YO, but they can include proactively supporting YWs on events/activities, coordinating peers, initiating new activities etc.

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.2a YP report feeling able to achieve their goals
Example Questions: What are some goals that you have (short- or long-term)? Are you working towards them, and if so, how? Do you feel you will be successful in achieving them?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Able to name some goals and steps they are taking towards it; they feel positive or confident about achieving them
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Is there any way [youth club] can help?
Comments: If YP shares some goals but say they do not feel they can achieve them, it is recommended to discuss what makes them feel this way and are there any specific barriers that can be addressed.

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.2b YP report an increase in confidence
Example Questions: How confident do you feel in yourself? What helps you feel more confident?
Examples of Indicative Answers: (Mostly) confident, talks about specific situations or factors that help them feel more confident. Attributes increase in confidence to attending YO
Comments: If YP struggle with this question, can ask them to imagine how confident they feel in specific situations, e.g. meeting new people, doing new things, achieving goals

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.2c YP are able to name something they are proud of
Example Questions: What is something that you have done that you are proud of?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Able to name specific things they are proud of

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.2d Percentage of YP who speak up and share their opinions in a group
Examples of Indicative Answers: Over 75%

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Outcome: 3.3  Improved aspirations and ambitions, including education, training and employment (ETE)
Indicator: 3.3a YP report willingness to try new things
Example Questions: How do you feel about trying new things (for example, new activities offered at your youth club)?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Excited; intrigued; confident
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Is there any way [youth club] can help?

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Example Questions: How do you feel about trying new things (for example, new activities offered at your youth club)? For YP with additional needs this Q might be rephrased to: How do you feel about trying new things (for example, new activities offered at your youth club) with your youth worker?
Type of Response: a) Very excited b) Somewhat excited c) I don't feel anything in particular; d) Cautious; e) Worried or very worried
Examples of Indicative Answers: Very excited or somewhat excited

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.3b YP report having tried new things in the last 6/9/12 months and are able to name specific examples
Example Questions: Have you tried any new things (for example, new activities offered at your youth club, new hobbies or learning opportunities) in the last 6/9/12 months? If so, what were they?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Are able to name specific new things that they have tried or taken up
Comments: Activities or things in mind should be seen as positive and contributing to YP's quality of life to some extent

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.3c Number of YP who took up new education, training and employment (ETE) opportunities in the last 6/9/12months (outside YO)
Comments: Opportunities include ETE: career-, education-, hobby- related opportunities

Outcome Area: 3  YP have a higher sense of agency and motivation
Indicator: 3.3d Number of YP taking leadership roles within YO in the last 6/9/12 months
Comments: Leadership roles can include leading on activities or events, initiating projects, taking up leadership opportunities

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1a YP report feeling connected to others
Example Questions: How connected do you feel to people in your life? How connected do you feel to people in your youth club?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Connected; close; talks about specific relationships and friendships they value

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Example Questions: How connected do you feel to people in your life / in your youth club? Please rate from 1 to 10 and tell us more about it.
Examples of Indicative Answers: 7 or above; talks about connections they value
Comments: If YP shares they do not have close friendships or relationships, YW should follow this up to check on their wellbeing

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1b YP feel that the youth workers are supportive and can provide examples
Example Questions: How supportive are your youth workers? If yes, can you tell about a specific  time they supported you?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Feels supported, included, values relationships with YW
Comments: YP might feel hesitant to speak about YWs if they are the ones asking the question - hesitancy might implicate they do not feel fully supported.

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Example Questions: How supportive are your youth workers? Please rate from 1 to 10 and tell us more about it.
Examples of Indicative Answers: 7 or above, talks about what they value in the relationships with YW

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1c YP feel that they can ask for help and advice within their youth club
Example Questions: If you were faced with a problem (at school, with your friends, with your hobbies), where would you look for help?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Mention of YO or Yws or peers at YO

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1d Number of YP who have proactively reached out for help or advice at YO in the last 6/9/12 months
Comments: Help or advice in regards to school/education, relationships, hobbies, goals. Could also include YP who accepted help when offered.

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1e YP report having made new friends
Example Questions: Have you made any new friends as a result of attending the youth club? Can you tell me about them?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Have made friends, can talk about them a little bit
Comments: This question might require a sensitive approach if asked in group settings; potentially anonymous methods are more suitable (e.g. post-it notes). If any YP seem distressed, YW should follow this up to check on their wellbeing

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1f YP report feeling comfortable meeting and spending time with people that are different from them
Example Questions: How do you feel about meeting and spending time with people who are different from you? This could be someone of a different age to you, a different religion, another culture etc. Can you share some examples, if you have any?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Excited; intrigued; comfortable
Optional Follow-Up Questions: - Why do you think you feel this way?

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1g YP report knowing how to solve interpersonal conflicts
Example Questions: If you had a conflict with someone in your life, how would you approach it?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Knows some specific constructive ways of solving a conflict

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.1h YP are able to solve conflicts within YO (with or without YW help)
Examples of Indicative Answers: YWs are able to name examples of YP solving conflicts within YO
Comments: It is up to observing YWs judgement to decide whether the group of YP is able to solve arising conflicts

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.2a YP report feeling connected to the local community
Example Questions: How connected do you feel to the local community/Islington? What helps you to feel more connected?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Connected; in touch; part of it; talks about the role of YO

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Example Questions: How connected do you feel to the local community/Islington? Please rate from 1 to 10. Can you tell us more about it?
Examples of Indicative Answers: 7 and above, able to explain why

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.2b YP report wanting to help or give back to the local community
Example Questions: Is there anything you would like to do to help the local community/Islington? If so, what?
Examples of Indicative Answers: Yes; able to name at least one thing they would like to contribute

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.3a Number of signposting/referral cases to other services in the community in the last 6/9/12 months
Comments: Includes other YOs, GP, community centres, charities. Where possible, collect data on types of referrals/examples

Outcome Area: 4  YP have strengthened connections with networks of support and communities
Indicator: 4.3b % of YP who take advantage of the referrals and signposting
Examples of Indicative Answers: Over 50%
Comments: Needs following up from 4.3a
